Title: Europe to end winter with gas stocks 48% full: Kpler Insight
Description: Plentiful gas in storage in Europe is expected to act as a safety cushion to the potential end of the Russian gas transit via Ukraine, resulting in a slightly higher pull from stocks than last year in a scenario of a colder 2024-2025 winter than last year, Kpler Insight forecasts.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC Gas cancels Das Island LNG expansion to focus on other "exciting" opportunities
Description: The UAE’s state-owned ADNOC Gas has decided to cancel its plans to increase the capacity at its 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG project, choosing instead to deploy its capital to explore other opportunities especially with parent firm ADNOC already developing the planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project in Abu Dhabi’s Al Ruwais industrial city.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Kansai Electric signs four-year contract with Oman LNG for 0.4 mtpa of LNG
Description: Japanese utility Kansai Electric has agreed to buy 0.4 mtpa of LNG from Oman LNG over four years starting in 2026, marking the start of a new supply relationship between the two firms.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s LNG regasification capacity to rise from first-quarter 2025 with Ravenna’s anticipated start
Description: Italy is expected to see a greater diversification in its LNG supplies when its LNG import capacity rises from the first quarter of next year, with the anticipated start of Snam’s planned 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside completes acquisition of Tellurian, Driftwood LNG
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has completed the acquisition of US project developer Tellurian and its proposed 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG project in Louisiana almost three months after announcing a definitive agreement to purchase all the shares in Tellurian and Driftwood in an all-cash deal for $900 million,
Author: CK
